ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
AASPIRE Participant Type / Version Administered
Notes: 1= Direct Report (DR); 2= Direct Report - Supported (DR-S); 3= Caregiver Report (CR)

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: Do you / Caregiver Report: Do you think that they) get the help (you/they) need to live in (your/their) home? For example, help with washing, dressing, cooking, cleaning.
Notes: 1= Not at all; 2= A little; 3= Moderately; 4= Mostly; 5= Totally

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: Can you / Caregiver Report: Do you think they can) get the help (you/they) need to take part in leisure activities? For example, things (you/they) like to do for fun, (your/their) hobbies and interests.
Notes: 1= Not at all; 2= A little; 3= Moderately; 4= Mostly; 5= Totally

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: Can you / Caregiver Report: Do you think they can) get the help (you/they) need to take part in social activities? For example, meeting friends or going out for a meal.
Notes: 1= Not at all; 2= A little; 3= Moderately; 4= Mostly; 5= Totally

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: Do you / Caregiver Report: Do you think that they) get enough support? For example, do (you/they) have enough help and support to meet (your/their) needs?
Notes: 1= Not at all; 2= A little; 3= Moderately; 4= Mostly; 5= Totally

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: Do you / Caregiver Report: Do you think that they and their caregivers) feel safe about the support you/they get? For example, do (you/they) feel secure and protected, that (you will not/they will likely not) have an accident or get hurt, that (you/they) will not become the victim of abuse?
Notes: 1= Not at all; 2= A little; 3= Moderately; 4= Mostly; 5= Totally

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: Do you / Caregiver Report: Do you think they) want or need formal support services (e.g., county disability services, vocational rehabilitation services, job coaching or employment services, brokerage services, wrap-around programs, day programs, or residential services) that (you/they) are not currently receiving?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 2= I am not sure

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: Have you / Caregiver Report: Do you think they have) been given enough information about (your/their) disability? For example, someone talked to (you/them) about (your/their) disability.
Notes: 1= Not at all; 2= A little; 3= Moderately; 4= Mostly; 5= Totally

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: Do you / Caregiver Report: Do you think they or their caregivers) know about the services and supports (you/they) can get to help (you/them)? For example, programs, services, therapies, support associations, aids, and equipment.
Notes: 1= Not at all; 2= A little; 3= Moderately; 4= Mostly; 5= Totally

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: Do you / Caregiver Report: Do you think they or their caregivers) know about the money and other benefits (you/they) can get to help (you/them)? For example, a pension, free transport, day services.
Notes: 1= Not at all; 2= A little; 3= Moderately; 4= Mostly; 5= Totally

ElementDescription: (Direct Report: Are you / Caregiver Report: Do you think they are) given information in a way that (you/they) can understand easily? For example, do people tell (you/them) things in a way (you/they) can understand and explain things clearly to (you/them); is written material easy to understand?
Notes: 1= Not at all; 2= A little; 3= Moderately; 4= Mostly; 5= Totally

ElementDescription: Overall, in the last six months, did the things this survey asked about...
Notes: 1= Get worse; 2= Stay about the same; 3= Get better

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) Did you get any help while answering the questions in this section of the survey?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): I did not get any help
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone helped me use a computer, smartphone, or other device (for example, they clicked on the answers I chose).
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone read the survey to me.
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone helped me understand what the questions or answers options meant.
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone helped me decide how to answer the questions on the survey.
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): I got some other type of help to answer the questions.
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone answered the questions for me, without my input.
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): They told me (in whatever mode they communicate)
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): I have observed the action, behavior, or event
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): I can interpret their behaviors and/or vocalizations
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): Someone else told me
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): I feel like I can guess because I have known them for a long time
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): I feel like I can guess because I spend a lot of time with them
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): Other
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): None of the above
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): Other, specify
(Caregiver Report) On a scale of 0 to 10, how confident are you about your responses?
Notes: 0= Not at all confident; 10= Totally confident

ElementDescription: Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
Overall Adequacy and Supports Score (Supports and Informational Supports subscore)
Notes: Higher scores indicate better overall adequacy of supports. Sum of (total_adsupsup, total_adsupinfo)

ElementDescription: Average Adequacy and Supports Score (Supports and Informational Supports subscore)
Notes: Mean of non-missing responses from (adsup_home, adsup_leisure, adsup_enough, adsup_social, adsup_safe, adsup_dis_info, adsup_available_support, adsup_available_benefits, adsup_understand_info)

ElementDescription: Adequacy of Supports - Supports Subscore
Notes: Higher numbers indicate more support. Sum of (adsup_home, adsup_leisure, adsup_enough, adsup_social, adsup_safe)

ElementDescription: Adequacy of Supports - Supports Mean of Non-Missing Responses
Notes: Higher numbers indicate more support. Mean of non-missing responses from (adsup_home, adsup_leisure, adsup_enough, adsup_social, adsup_safe)

ElementDescription: Adequacy of Supports - Informational Supports Subscore
Notes: Higher scores indicate more informational support. Sum of (adsup_dis_info, adsup_available_support, adsup_available_benefits, adsup_understand_info)

ElementDescription: Adequacy of Supports - Informational Supports Mean of Non-Missing Responses
Notes: Higher scores indicate more informational support. Mean of non-missing responses from (adsup_dis_info, adsup_available_support, adsup_available_benefits, adsup_understand_info)
